member.name: T:Aspose.Tasks.Calendar
member.summary: Represents a calendar used in a project.
member.remarks: Calendars are used to define standard working and non-working times. Projects must have one base calendar. Tasks and resources can have their own non-base calendars that are based on a base calendar.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Constructs calendar and sets Id value.

member.summary: Constructs calendar with a name.
member.param: The name of the created calendar.

member.summary: Determines whether the day is working day.
member.returns: True if the day is working day.

member.summary: Return working hours for the specified dates.

member.summary: Calculates the date when the specified amount of work time will pass according to the calendar.

member.name: M:Aspose.Tasks.Calendar.GetTaskFinishDateFromDuration(Aspose.Tasks.Task,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Calculates the task finish date and time from its start date, split parts and the duration.
member.remarks: Returns DatiTime.MinValue if task is summary, null or its start date is not set.

member.summary: Returns amount of working hours at the date.

member.summary: Calculates next working day start from the date.

member.name: T:Aspose.Tasks.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Tasks.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Tasks.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Tasks.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.
